comment.body: You could do like Jro said and setup a single site proxy. But if you lack the hosting capability then I'd suggest linking directly to your site on a public proxy.

I'm not familiar with ZeroBlog but if it doesn't support a direct upload feature you could always stick it in a img directory on the site and resign it. Then link directly. Edit: Found [this](/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:101:Image+uploading+and+zooming)
Post any errors you have so people can check them out.
@Jjg: np. :D
Welcome.

I see you also have your zeronet on a server instead of your main computer. I suggest removing the address so your links can work for everyone. [fixed link](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj/1485876841)

    [fixed link](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj/1485876841)

You have 2 options that I know of:
1. Create a website that gives you permission to modify the files in a certain directory
2. Create a static website which you simply resign and publish when you modify something.

The second option is much easier, but if you are capable, the first is actually much faster.

regardless, each time someone has to sign it, whether it be with your personal key or the site's private key.

@crypdick: Sorry. Been away for most of today. I looked at your site.

Your relative links are broken because you don't include the site address, which is required for zeronet because zeronet itself acts as the 'host' and sites are merely directories on the web server. Instead of '/cv', the correct way is '/richarddecal.bit/cv'

Also, your avatar is the same way. '/richarddecal.bit/img/avatar-icon.png' instead of '/img/avatar-icon.png'

Hope this helps.


Edit: You could also do './cv' instead of '/cv' if your paths only go into a single depth. If you use this on say /cv/newpage.html, it would break it because instead of going back to cv like you'd want, it would go to /cv/cv

But for maximum compatibility, my first suggestion would be best.
It's hard to shut zeronet down,  if at all
The option is good if you are running multiple instances of zeronet (say, desktop and laptop) with the same user.json and sites.json (so you could post here on either)

Optional files.

Allows you to have a tiny minimum (basically youd want the js and the css and the main page), but have everything else as optional. That way it's only downloaded when it is specifically requested

My CDN (though it's like 8 MB) loads instantly because only the important stuff isn't optional. The only thing users have to download is about 15 KB.

Hmm. Something you can try:
** Backup Sites.json and Users.json before proceeding. Things happen **
1. Delete ZeroMe and all of the hubs you are hosting ** Save the link to the one your profile is hosted on (/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v) **
2. Goto [OrangeHub](/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v) to reinitiate sync
3. Click activate ZeroMe to redownload ZeroMe
4. Wait for everything to sync. ** DO NOT CREATE A NEW PROFILE, THIS WILL WIPE YOUR OLD ONE **
5. You should be able to post again. Once EVERYTHING is synced up, you may goto 0hub.bit and redownload the hubs you want.
@Dogman: Heh. I switch between Linux and Windows a lot, so I have mine on an old laptop I don't really use anymore. Lets my zeronet stay up to date while allowing me to still swap OSs
I may try forking one of these editors and host it on a zite so we can continue to avoid the clearnet.
not necessarily, but caffeine addiction is!

You can use [ZeroBlog](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroBlog) or write your own.
@Dogman: I drink caffeine free Dr. Pepper now. Feels great. Heart rate was way too high before.

@Martinv: Honestly, I've never seen this. Probably something to do with signing more than likely.

Do you get a "published to x/x peers" toast?
@Martinv: hmm. then it doesn't seem like your new comments are getting signed correctly.
One exists, but I don't have the address
i bothered with it when it was early just for profit. made like $80 mining it.
@Martinv: hmm. Yeah. if you can comment on some people but not all, then I have no idea. My solution may or may not work. no idea. But that's how you could properly reinstall zerome.
@Dogman: to mine? No. I mined in a pool. But this was months ago. Unprofitable to do it now.
@TheFuzzStone: Currently working on a few other things first ;)
Hello

Buy AMD Skrub >:D

In seriousness:
Driver update maybe?
just install the mute script someone posted a while back. fixes the problem
@Cyberfoo: No problem
@Cyberfoo: why did you follow someone you wanted to block? :p

Since you seem new to scripts:
https://greasyfork.org/en

ZN 0.5.2 has a built in mute feature. However, ZeroMe has yet to take advantage of it. Once it becomes available, the script I posted will be obsolete. Should see it updated within the next couple of days.

AH. you can mute people from the ZeroID site.
What did you expect would happen if you tried to cheat?

Muting is completely client side. So don't worry about that. In fact, it's not even saved across peers. Notice when you mute someone it doesn't say "published to x/x peers." 100% client side. :)

I use a script to filter non-latin posts.
Just hides everything from you.
@Cyberfoo: can always try it. Unmute people by clicking the three dots in ZeroHello. Just did it myself.
Opposite here. Every blurred image is innocent until I realize it's cp. Then I just -.-
You could do it manually. Scan all user's json files and build a tree.
@Brahman: not really temporary. You could also read the database if you don't want to index yourself.
